original: Bensow, Frank Sigurd, civilingenjör, major, NoTrköping, f. 11/3/83 i Gbg av tandl. Victor B. o. Sigrid Boye. G. 10 m. Sigrid Nauclér. — Mog:ex. v. Gbgs real 01, utex. fr. KTH (VoV) 05, res:off:ex. 05. Und:löjtn. i fortif. res. 05, löjtn. 12, löjtn. VVK s. å., kapt. VVK 19 o. major 38. A-B v. nybyggn. av Ljungaverkens vattenkraftstat. 10-11, avd :ing. v. Nässjö-Sävsjöströms järnv:byggn. 12-13, arbxhef h. Holmens Bruks & Fabr. A-B v. bygg. av Hallsta Pappersbruk 13-15, byggnxhef h. samma föret, i Norrköp. sed. 16. Sekr. resp. v. ordf. i styr. f. Norrköp. polytekn. fören. 21-32, förste v. ordf. o. ålders-pres. i drätselkamm., v. ordf. i dess byggniavd. o. i byggn :ndn, led. av gen:planeberedn., stadshus-, lasarett-o. museibyggn :komm., löne- o. pens:-ndn, ordf. i styr. f. stadsbibi. o. konstmus. t. 45, ordf. i styr. f. Norrköp. mus., led. av styr. f. Blomska etift. t. 45, Fören. gamla Norrköp. o. hed :led. i Norrköp. go’lfkl., verks t. led. av De Geer-komm. Medl. av Sv. tekn :fören. o. Frimurarorden. Stud :res. t. Norge, Danm., Finl., Tyskl., Framkr., Engk, Schweiz, Tjeckoslov., Ital., Belg., HoU. o. Polen. Skr.: Norr köp. ’Stadshus, Antikens väg- o. vattenbyggnrkonst i nutida belysn. translated: Bensow, Frank Sigurd, engineer, major, born on March 11, 1883 in Gothenburg to dentist Victor B. and Sigrid Boye. Married Sigrid Nauclér in 1910. Completed secondary education at Gothenburg's Realskolan in 1901, graduated from the Royal Institute of Technology (VoV) in 1905, and passed the reserve officer examination the same year. Started as a second lieutenant in fortification, became a lieutenant in 1912, lieutenant in the Military High School in 1912, captain in the Military High School in 1919, and major in 1938. Worked as an engineer in various road and water building districts, and was a member of the road and water construction board from 1905-1910. Worked as a consultant for engineering firm Unander & Johnson and Kreuger & ToM from 1909-1910, chief engineer and department manager of the Stockholm Superphosphate Factory AB during the new construction of the Ljungaverk water power station from 1910-1911, department engineer of the Nässjö-Sävsjöströms railway construction from 1912-1913, head of construction at Holmens Bruks & Fabr. AB during the construction of the Hallsta Paper Mill from 1913-1915, and head of construction for the same company in Norrköping since 1916. Secretary and chairman of Norrköp. Polytechnic Association board from 1921-1932, first vice-chairman and then chairman of the council, vice-chairman of its building department and the building committee, a member of the general planning board, city hall, hospital, and museum building committees, salary and pension committees, chairman of the board of the city library and art museum until 1945, chairman of the board of Norrköp. Mus. until 1945, member of the board of the Blom Foundation. Member of the Association of Old Norrköping and honorary member of the Norrköp. Golf Club, committee member of the De Geer Committee. Member of the Swedish Technical Association and Freemasonry. Studied in Norway, Denmark, Finland, Germany, France, Switzerland, Czechoslovakia, Italy, Belgium, Holland and Poland. Wrote Norrköping's town hall, Classical road and water building art in a modern light. Hobbies: art history, botany, golf. Received the Royal Order of Vasa, Pro Patria Gold Medal, St. Olaf Medal, and the East Gothia Sports Association Medal of Merit.
